description.narrative: Expand access to education: The proposed Project will allow Ashesi to grow capacity and provide education to more than 1,200 students towards 2020 (of which 20% from other countries in the region). Promoting quality tertiary education in Ghana: By supporting Ashesi, IFC can make a meaningful contribution to the quality agenda for Ghana Higher Education and, more broadly, to that of the West African region as Ashesi is a quality provider of educational services in Ghana. Increase affordability to education: Ashesi offers tuition grants to part of its students to promote diversity and inclusiveness. This provides the opportunity to access quality tertiary education for those who would have otherwise not be able to afford it. The proposed Project will allow Ashesi to expand capacity and in turn allow more students to benefit from such tuition grant. Employability: As Ashesi focuses on developing industry and job demanding majors, the proposed Project is expected to improve employability in Ghana and Sub-Saharan Africa. More than 90% of Ashesi graduates are placed in jobs or graduate programs within three months of graduation and over 90% of them work in Africa.

table, .k-table{ border-collapse:collapse; width:100%; table-layout:fixed; margin-bottom: 15px;} .k-table, .k-table td, table, table td {outline: 0;border: 1px solid #000; } .k-table td, table td { padding: 5px; } Ashesi University College (Ashesi) is a private not-for-profit liberal arts college in Accra, Ghana with a current student body of 800 students focused on providing quality education and promoting ethics and personal empowerment. After having operated out of leased facilities since inception in 2002, Ashesi has relocated in 2011 in an entirely new physical campus in Berekuso, 15 miles outside of Accra. As part of its ongoing expansion program, Ashesi is seeking to raise $31.9 million to build additional facilities and expand capacity. The expansion includes the construction of a research and learning center, a student hostel, a student center, a sport center and an innovation center. Ashesi is seeking IFC financial support to help with delivering on its expansion plan.
